It is characterized by its unique underground growth habit, with most of its structure hidden beneath the soil surface. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are often overlooked due to its cryptic morphology. Its leaves are typically narrow and adapted to low-light conditions, reflecting its habitat in shaded, forested environments. Due to its rarity and specialized ecological requirements, it is considered a poorly understood species in botanical studies.
